artworkTitle: Prehistoric Art depicted in Post-Impressionism Art Style

keySubjects: Cave walls or rocky landscape elements (as subject matter)
conceptDefinition.narrativeFocus: Depict a group of simplified, active human figures engaged in hunting a large bison or similar prehistoric animal. Focus on the action and relationship between hunters and prey.
conceptDefinition.desiredEmotion: A mix of ritualistic reverence, primal tension, and the importance of the hunt for survival.
symbolismHints: Emphasize the size and power of the animal
Use repetitive patterns if suggesting ritual
references: Altamira cave art depictions of bison

visualCharacteristics: Not a unified style, but diverse reactions extending or rejecting Impressionism's core tenets
Common aim to move beyond capturing fleeting visual impressions towards greater structure, expression, symbolism, or form

Tendencies include: emphasis on geometric structure (Cézanne), symbolic/arbitrary use of color (Gauguin), intense emotional expression through color and brushwork (Van Gogh), scientific approach to color/form (Seurat)
May feature simplified or abstracted forms, flattened perspective, strong outlines (Cloisonnism), or fragmented viewpoints
Subjectivity and personal vision become more prominent
techniques: Highly varied techniques reflecting individual artists' goals:
Pointillism/Divisionism (Seurat): Applying small dots/dashes of pure color
Impasto (Van Gogh): Thick application of paint conveying energy
Synthetism/Cloisonnism (Gauguin): Flat areas of bold color with dark outlines
Constructive Brushwork (Cézanne): Building form with parallel/hatched strokes
styleDefinition.mediumSimulation: Oil painting on canvas (acknowledging diverse application methods)

colorPalette.description: Highly diverse color use, moving beyond naturalistic light. Can be: scientifically applied dots for optical mixing (Seurat); intensely emotional and subjective (Van Gogh); symbolic, arbitrary, and non-naturalistic flat areas (Gauguin); or used structurally to build form (Cézanne).
keyColors: (Gauguin: Rich Reds, Yellows, Pinks, non-local colors)

styleDefinition.textureEmphasis: Highly variable depending on the artist. Can range from the calculated texture of Pointillism (Seurat), to the thick, energetic impasto conveying emotion (Van Gogh), to flatter decorative surfaces (Gauguin), or the visible structure of 'constructive' brushstrokes (Cézanne).
styleDefinition.compositionStyle: Diverse strategies moving beyond Impressionist informality. Includes: seeking underlying geometric structure and stability (Cézanne); creating highly ordered, formal compositions (Seurat); using dynamic, swirling compositions to express emotion (Van Gogh); employing flattened perspectives and decorative arrangements (Gauguin).
references: Paul Cézanne ('Mont Sainte-Victoire' series, Still Lifes)
Paul Gauguin ('Where Do We Come From? What Are We? Where Are We Going?')
Georges Seurat ('A Sunday Afternoon on the Island of La Grande Jatte')
Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec (Posters, depictions of Parisian life)

sceneContext.lightingStyle: Flat, even, bright lighting with no discernible source or shadows, typical of Egyptian art.
sceneContext.cameraView: Strict profile or composite view, straight-on perspective, avoiding complex angles.
sceneContext.settingSuggestion: A stylized representation of a cave interior or outdoor landscape, framed perhaps with simple geometric Egyptian borders or patterns.

avoid: Dynamic, fluid poses (use stiff Egyptian poses)
